title: How to make moon milk, a staple beverage in Ayurvedic medicine that may improve your sleep
author: Brooke Helton
description: In search of a new bedtime drink? Try moon milk — a relaxing blend of warm milk and herbs known to help lower anxiety, stress, and inflammation.
cleaned_text: - Moon milk combines dairy or non-dairy milk with herbs like ashwaganda, turmeric, and cinnamon. - This Ayurvedic beverage may help you feel calm and relaxed, which could help you sleep better. - You can find pre-made moon milk in some stores or make your own unique blend at home. Moon milk may be a rising star on social media, but this soothing beverage isn't anything new. It's a staple beverage in [Ayurveda](https://www.nccih.nih.gov/health/ayurvedic-medicine-in-depth), India's [traditional healthcare system](https://www.insider.com/what-is-ayurvedic-medicine-doctors-explain-the-indian-practice-2022-3). Ayurvedic medicine, which dates back [nearly 5,000 years](https://www.takingcharge.csh.umn.edu/where-ayurveda-come-from#:~:text=Ayurvedic%20medicine%20has%20a%20rich,(1200%2D1000%20BCE).), is one of the oldest medical systems in the world. It approaches wellness from a [holistic standpoint](https://www.hopkinsmedicine.org/health/wellness-and-prevention/ayurveda), often by combining herbal remedies with lifestyle and dietary changes. As its name suggests, moon milk is a remedy that may help improve your rest. You can take this blend of milk and herbs before bed to aid with sleep and relaxation, says [Daniel Powers](https://botanicalinstitute.org/author/daniel-powers/), master of science in herbal medicine and founder of [The Botanical Institute](https://botanicalinstitute.org/). What's more, you don't need to head to the moon and back to try this drink, either. Read on to learn more about the benefits of this Ayurvedic beverage and discover a moon milk recipe you can make at home. Moon milk benefits Moon milk could provide a variety of benefits, such as [improving sleep](https://www.insider.com/guides/health/treatments/how-to-get-more-deep-sleep) or [reducing stress](https://www.insider.com/easy-ways-to-be-less-stressed-2018-8), says [Maddie Pasquariello](https://nutritionwithmaddie.com/about), a registered dietitian in private practice. However, the exact effects can vary — namely, because there's no one standard recipe. Rather, the recipe for moon milk tends to vary from person to person, based on your taste preferences and the herbs you have on hand, Powers says. That said, according to Powers, moon milk recipes often contain three standard ingredients: - Ashwagandha [Turmeric](https://www.insider.com/guides/health/diet-nutrition/turmeric-benefits) - Dairy or non-dairy milk Turmeric and [ashwagandha](https://www.insider.com/guides/health/diet-nutrition/ashwagandha-benefits) are both [adaptogens](https://my.clevelandclinic.org/health/drugs/22361-adaptogens) — plants that help your body deal with fatigue, anxiety, and stress. Their potential benefits include: - Reducing inflammation: Research links curcumin, the active ingredient in turmeric, with [lowered inflammation levels](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5664031/). At least one study also associates ashwagandha with [anti-inflammatory effects](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6979308/). - Supporting cognitive health: Some research links ashwagandha to [improved neurological health](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/32305638/), Pasquariello says. One study associated ashwagandha with [better cognitive function](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/28471731/#:~:text=Conclusions%3A%20Ashwagandha%20may%20be%20effective,attention%2C%20and%20information%20processing%20speed.), like improved memory, focus, and executive function. - Promoting calm: Some [research](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/31423805/)links taking curcumin with reduced symptoms of depression and anxiety. Another [small study](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6979308/)on ashwagandha connected it with lower levels of [cortisol](https://www.insider.com/guides/health/mental-health/stress-definition)— the [main stress hormone](https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/stress-management/in-depth/stress/art-20046037). - Acting as an antioxidant: Curcumin [acts an antioxidant](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7694612/). These compounds help neutralize disease-causing [free radicals](https://www.insider.com/guides/health/diet-nutrition/free-radicals)in your body. - Improving sleep: Research suggests ashwagandha may lead to [improved sleep](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6979308/)for some people. Beyond the adaptogenic herbs, the milk you choose as your base could also boost its health benefits. For example, [cow's milk](https://www.insider.com/guides/health/diet-nutrition/is-milk-bad-for-you) contains a number of vitamins, minerals, and proteins that help your body function, including: [Calcium](https://www.ucsfhealth.org/education/calcium-content-of-foods): As the most abundant mineral in your body, calcium helps [promote strong bones](https://www.insider.com/study-vegans-face-higher-risk-bone-fractures-than-omnivores-2020-11)and [teeth](https://www.insider.com/guides/health/dental/toothpaste-ingredients). [Vitamin D](https://www.insider.com/guides/health/diet-nutrition/vitamin-d3-benefits): Vitamin system](https://www.insider.com/how-to-get-vitamin-d-support-immune-system-against-coronavirus-2020-5)and your body produce](https://medlineplus.gov/ency/article/002332.htm) [serotonin](https://www.insider.com/guides/health/mental-health/how-to-increase-serotonin)and [melatonin](https://www.insider.com/guides/health/treatments/how-much-is-too-much-melatonin)— hormones that influence your sleep. It's why warm milk is often a [go-to bedtime drink](https://www.insider.com/foods-that-will-help-you-sleep-better-2017-10). Don't worry if you're dairy free, though. Plenty of [plant-based milks](https://www.insider.com/milk-nutritional-differences-dairy-oat-almond-soy-calories-protein-chart-2022-4) can still benefit your moon milk. as vitamins like [A](https://www.insider.com/guides/health/diet-nutrition/vitamin-a-benefits), [D](https://www.insider.com/guides/health/diet-nutrition/vitamin-d-deficiency), and [B12](https://www.insider.com/what-vitamin-b12-does-to-your-brain-and-body-2022-11). How to try moon milk If you're ready to bring moon milk into your bedtime routine, your local grocery store might have you covered. Some brands sell powdered mixes on the shelves, or premade moon milk in the dairy aisle. Brands to try include: [Clover Sonoma](https://www.wholefoodsmarket.com/product/clover-sonoma-organic-golden-moon-milk-1-each-b09pfq71sk), which you can find at Whole Foods. [Z Natural Foods](https://affiliate.insider.com/?amazonTrackingID=biauto-61351-20&h=f177255a419f33ac250aa6316a77e5bfec8c0e3ac5a812a945ed9f5f5c82ec23&postID=63dbf9c632953034c357fa84&postSlug=guides%2Fhealth%2Fdiet-nutrition%2Fmoon-milk&site=in&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Fip%2FOrganic-Moon-Milk-Powder%2F757187226&platform=browser&sc=false&disabled=false), which you can find at Walmart. However, you can also whip up some moon milk at home. Homemade moon milk If you're ready to try your hand at this Ayurvedic remedy, you can test this recipe from Powers: Ingredients: - 1 teaspoon (tsp) [organic ground ashwagandha](https://affiliate.insider.com/?amazonTrackingID=biauto-61351-20&h=5ed0cd6967975aeb639ae431c99bdeef37c6f39ae09ff4259b6c47fc6c2686d1&postID=63dbf9c632953034c357fa84&postSlug=guides%2Fhealth%2Fdiet-nutrition%2Fmoon-milk&site=in&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FBanyan-Botanicals-Organic-Ashwagandha-Powder%2Fdp%2FB005PBA6F8&platform=browser&sc=false&disabled=false) - 1 tsp organic ground turmeric (optional) - 1 tsp organic ground [cinnamon](https://www.insider.com/guides/health/diet-nutrition/cinnamon-benefits)(optional) - 1/4 tsp [cardamom](https://www.insider.com/guides/health/diet-nutrition/cardamom-benefits)seed powder (optional) [coconut oil](https://www.insider.com/what-can-you-do-with-coconut-oil-2017-3), [ghee](https://www.insider.com/guides/kitchen/what-is-clarified-butter), or [alternative butter](https://www.insider.com/how-to-substitute-baking-ingredients-eggs-milk-butter-yeast-2020-4) - 1 cup organic whole milk, or your plant-based milk of choice - Sweetener to taste, like a teaspoon of raw honey or maple syrup Directions: To blend your moon milk together: - Combine your milk and oil or ghee, then heat the mixture on the stove until it's warm, but not boiling. Alternatively, you can microwave it for 1-2 minutes. - Add your herbs to the milk and oil and mix with a [whisk](https://www.insider.com/guides/kitchen/best-whisk)or [handheld blender](https://www.insider.com/guides/kitchen/best-hand-mixer)until smooth and creamy. You could also toss your mixture into a [standing blender](https://www.insider.com/guides/kitchen/best-blenders)and pulse for a few seconds. - Pour into your [favorite mug](https://www.insider.com/guides/kitchen/best-coffee-mug)and enjoy while it's still warm. Ingredient substitutions If you're fresh out of cinnamon or cardamom, not to worry. You can customize this moon milk recipe with your other [favorite herbs or spices](https://www.insider.com/guides/kitchen/do-spices-go-bad), like: - Ginger: This herb [may help with](https://www.insider.com/guides/health/diet-nutrition/ginger-benefits)indigestion, nausea, or inflammation and give your moon milk a warm, comforting taste, like a gingerbread latte. - Black pepper: If you want to give your moon milk a kick, try adding some [black pepper](https://www.insider.com/guides/health/diet-nutrition/black-pepper-benefits)— this spice may help reduce inflammation, regulate cholesterol, and ease indigestion. - Astragalus: [Research](https://www.mountsinai.org/health-library/herb/astragalus)links this adaptogenic herb with anti-bacterial and anti-inflammatory properties. - Almond extract: If you don't have vanilla extract on hand, almond extract could lend your moon milk a nutty flavor. Feel free to mix and match different herbs, sweeteners, and milk to create the perfect custom moon milk for you, Powers says. How to enjoy your moon milk Once you've got your warm homemade or store-bought moon milk in hand, you can make it extra relaxing by combining it with other activities in your bedtime routine, such as: - Turning the lights down low - Playing soothing music - Sipping your moon milk with a [sleep-friendly snack](https://www.insider.com/foods-to-eat-for-better-sleep-2017-5) Insider's takeaway Moon milk is more than just a passing phase. It's a staple of Ayurvedic medicine designed to promote relaxation and restful sleep. The exact benefits can vary based on your recipe — but staple ingredients, like ashwagandha and turmeric, may help reduce inflammation and ease feelings of anxiety and stress. You can buy moon milk premade in stores, or make it yourself to customize the flavors and potential benefits. "Don't feel like you have to make an exact moon milk recipe according to the book. Moon milk is an interpretive recipe: Make it based on whatever herbs you have on hand," Powers says.
